meanings.definition: The state or quality of being sentient.
meanings.sent1: The sentiency of the puppy was evident as it wagged its tail happily.
meanings.sent2: Her sentiency allowed her to empathize with others' emotions.
meanings.sent3: The sentiency of the teddy bear made the children believe it could understand them.
meanings.sent4: The sentiency of the old tree seemed to whisper ancient stories to those who listened.
meanings.sent5: The sentiency of the music touched the audience's hearts deeply.

meanings.definition: The capacity to feel, perceive, or experience subjectively.
meanings.sent1: The sentiency of the baby was clear as it giggled at the funny faces.
meanings.sent2: Animals exhibit sentiency through their reactions to different stimuli.
meanings.sent3: The sentiency of the robot trying to understand humor was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: In the artist's painting, the ocean seemed to possess a sentiency of its own.
meanings.sent5: The sentiency of the character in the book made readers emotionally invested in the story.
